subject: Management
title: The Thomas-Kilmann Model
description: A quick, practical guide to The Thomas-Kilmann Model.

hook.text: Five managers faced the same conflict. Each handled it completely differently. All felt justified.

buildup.text: People have default conflict styles. Most don't realize they're choosing one.

discovery.text: Thomas and Kilmann mapped five styles: competing, collaborating, compromising, avoiding, accommodating.

twist.text: No style is always right. Each works in specific situations and fails in others.

climax.text: Know your default style. Then learn when to switch to a different one.

punchline.text: Your default isn't your only option. It's just your habit.

quiz.question: What does the Thomas-Kilmann model describe?
options: Five conflict-handling styles that work in different situations
A single best approach for resolving all workplace conflicts
How to avoid conflict entirely in professional settings
